meanings.definition: The act of pulling or tearing out forcibly.
meanings.sent1: The evulsion of the weed from the ground was difficult.
meanings.sent2: The dentist performed an evulsion of the decayed tooth.
meanings.sent3: During the game, the player's evulsion of the opponent's flag was swift.
meanings.sent4: The evulsion of the old tree symbolized a fresh start for the garden.
meanings.sent5: The evulsion of the splinter was a relief for the child.

meanings.definition: The surgical removal of a tooth or other body part.
meanings.sent1: The evulsion of the wisdom tooth was necessary for the patient's health.
meanings.sent2: After the accident, the evulsion of the damaged limb was performed.
meanings.sent3: The evulsion of the toy from the child's grasp caused a tantrum.
meanings.sent4: Her evulsion of toxic relationships from her life was empowering.
meanings.sent5: The evulsion of the tumor saved the patient's life.

meanings.definition: The process of uprooting or removing something completely.
meanings.sent1: The evulsion of the invasive plant species was crucial for the ecosystem.
meanings.sent2: The evulsion of the old carpet revealed a beautiful hardwood floor.
meanings.sent3: The evulsion of the outdated policy led to positive changes in the company.
meanings.sent4: His evulsion of negative thoughts transformed his outlook on life.
meanings.sent5: The evulsion of the dictator from power brought hope to the nation.
